book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values. Prepared by Prof. Dr. Abd al-Salam al-Harras, Fes - Morocco. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values. This topic has been addressed by a number of researchers and preachers to the extent that writing about it has become akin to repetition and regurgitation. Nevertheless, I was inclined to address it without feeling compelled to review previous writings, which vary between three levels: the excellent, the good, and the less than good. It is well known that the Holy Quran described the Islamic nation as 'middle' (moderate/just) in the Almighty's saying: {And thus we have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you.} (1)

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The meaning of 'Middle' (Wasat) as interpreted by the Quran in another verse is 'The Best' (Khayriyyah): The Almighty said: {You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind.} (1) In the language: The 'middle' of the pasture is its best part; the 'middle' of a thing is its best and most just part; and the 'middle' of the necklace (Wasitat al-Qiladah) is the jewel that is in its center (2), which is its most precious gem. In *Al-Sahah*: "The middle of the necklace is the jewel that is in its center, and it is the finest of them." The Imam interpreted it as meaning the best of religions, and 'so-and-so is from the middle of his people' means their best, most noble, and finest. From this, the 'Middle Prayer' was named because it is the best of prayers and the greatest in reward, which is why it was singled out for maintenance. The Prophet (peace be upon him) was described as being from the 'middle' of his people. Ibn al-Rumi mourned his best son saying: 'Death aimed at the middle of my children ... By God, how it chose the jewel of the necklace.' Islam is built upon goodness, justice, benevolence, kindness, trustworthiness, truthfulness, chastity, integrity of the heart, sovereignty of reason, responsible freedom, respect for the other, humility, mercy, integrity, and modesty, among other values that are worthy of emulation.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The Islamic nation was addressed with great Quranic verses defining its mission under Islam in the Almighty's saying: {You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah} (1). It is as if He said: "You are the best nation in existence now because corruption has prevailed over all nations, so what is right is not known in them, nor is what is wrong forbidden, and they do not possess the faith that restrains its people from evil and directs them to good. Whereas you enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and you believe in Allah with a true faith that reflects its effect in action, and thus 'Kan' (to be) is complete/perfect here." It was also said it is incomplete/past tense: "Meaning you were in God's knowledge and in the Preserved Tablet, or you were in the previous nations as found in their books prophesying you as the best nation produced for mankind." Whatever the estimation, the nation of Muhammad is the best nation produced for mankind, and it deserved this superiority through the three mentioned merits: enjoining the good, forbidding the evil, continuing in faith in Allah, and holding fast all together to the rope of Allah. (2)

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: If this nation holds this status and rank chosen for it by Allah Almighty, then it must realize this within itself and its soul, as stated in the Almighty's saying: {And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.} (1) This expression is more beautiful and fulfilling of the intent, just as you say: 'Let me have a friend in you.' It implies an urging for action, exertion of effort, and excellence in following, so that the community of believers in this religion deserves to attain the honor of that status and rank before being granted power. This is done by calling to good, enjoining right, and forbidding wrong within its own circle, exchanging counsel of truth and patience among themselves. And after being granted power, [it continues] in carrying out its mission within its society, maintaining the three characteristics that qualified it to be the nation of good calling to good. Is there any good greater than Islam? {Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam} (2), {And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers} (3). It is the religion that Allah is pleased with for us and commanded us to hold fast to and not die except...

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...while we are Muslims. However, the mission of enjoining good and forbidding evil after being granted power, and even more so before it, must be with wisdom, good instruction, and arguing in the best way. For the slogan of Islam in its call is: {There is no compulsion in religion}. I was pleased with a statement in *Al-Manar* explaining that enjoining good and forbidding evil does not mean drawing the sword and raising the whip to coerce people into entering Islam on the grounds that it is the most known of good deeds, or to make them quit disbelief on the grounds that it is the most denounced of evil deeds. The author of *Al-Manar* says: "This saying is false, built upon unstable foundations... Among them: that compulsion in religion is negated in Islam by the text of the Quran, and the Messenger (peace be upon him) did not fight anyone from the Arabs or others for the sake of coercion into Islam; rather, he fought in defense. How could he attempt coercion when Allah Almighty says: {So would you compel the people in order that they become believers?} (1). He distinguished between enjoining good/forbidding evil and the obligation of changing evil, and clarified that the mission of that is not calling to Islam and forcing it [upon people].

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The statement of Al-Qaffal, quoted by Al-Razi, contradicts His saying - the Almighty - in Surah Al-Hajj describing the believers after they were permitted to fight those who aggressed against them: {Those who, if We establish them in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong} (1). So, the Almighty made enjoining good and forbidding evil one of their descriptions after being established in the land, and that is not done through Jihad [warfare], but after it (2). One of the most beautiful and greatest things mentioned in this verse, as previously indicated, is the glad tidings of the goodness of this nation, provided that it strives against itself for faith in the truth, acting upon it, walking in its guidance, and calling to it with wisdom, good instruction, and everything that is good and best, and having patience in that. This implies searching for the most successful means, the most beautiful paths, the most effective methods, and the most upright discourse presented through good example and benevolent role models, bringing good tidings of good and encouraging it. And 'Good' is: "What is desired by all, such as intellect, justice, virtue, and useful things; it is an absolute good desired by everyone and for everyone" (3).

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: Allah has described the groups of Muslims and their individuals as being 'the successful ones' (Al-Muflihoon) specifically and emphatically, and they have high ranks due to the use of the demonstrative pronoun "those" (Ula'ika), because they invite to good, enjoin every right, and forbid every wrong. If this is achieved by them, they are the "Middle Nation" and the "Nation of Witness" over all people, and the Messenger (peace be upon him) will be a witness over them. Thus, we see these three verses are consistent, one following the other: The first explains that this nation was the best nation brought forth for people in God's knowledge or in the Preserved Tablet. The second: That this nation must work and make of itself what is required of it: {And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good} (1). The fruit of that is its entitlement to be the nation of witness over people. It does not deserve that unless the conditions of witnessing are realized in it, the most important of which are: Knowledge, Justice, Integrity on the Straight Path, and all eternal values, lofty morals, and praiseworthy traits expressed by the Holy Quran with miraculous brevity: "With the Middle (Wasat)," which is justice, choice, and high status achieved by its inclusion of all human rights, its good balance between matter and spirit, and its freedom or innocence from excess there and negligence here, and extremism...

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...there and shortcoming here (1). The Messenger (peace be upon him) is the witness over his nation which Allah Almighty honored with moderation (Wasatiyyah) because he is the perfect example of the middle rank. This nation is only 'middle' by following him (peace be upon him) in his biography and his law... As if Allah is saying: The description of 'Middle' is only realized for you if you maintain action upon the guidance of the Messenger (peace be upon him) and remain upright on his Sunnah (2). This moderation is what is mentioned in Al-Fatiha as the "Straight Path" which Allah commanded us to recite in every prayer as it is the Mother of the Book. Among the characteristics of this Straight Path is that it leads to the noble goal, and it alone does so, unlike other twisted, crooked, deviant, difficult paths, or those full of potholes and unevenness. It is a path familiarized by those walking to Allah among those upon whom He has bestowed favor, not those who have evoked [His] anger—those who knew the truth and opposed it—nor of those who are astray—those who were ignorant of the truth and strove in their ignorance and persisted in their error. So the Middle Nation is between these two extremes that deviate from the truth.
foot_note:
1. (1) See Tafsir Abi Al-Saud 204 / 1 Dar Al-Fikr. 
2. See Tafsir Al-Manar 1 / 4 - 5.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The Holy Quran expressed this moderation as a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire; light upon light, Allah guides to His light whom He wills. It is the white clear path, its night is like its day, from which no one deviates except he who is doomed, as stated in the Noble Hadith. Just as Allah made the Islamic nation a 'middle' among nations, He made its Qibla (direction of prayer) a 'middle' among directions, and He Almighty guided it to it and called it the Straight Path, saying: {To Allah belongs the east and the west. He guides whom He wills to a straight path} (1). Thus, it is a middle nation in the Qibla of prayer, i.e., in directions, just as He made it middle among nations (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Al-Baqarah: 142. 
2. Bada'i' al-Fawa'id by Ibn al-Qayyim al-Jawziyya 1 / 158 - 159. See also the book 'The Kaaba is the Center of the World' p. 148, 204 by Dr. Saad al-Marsaifi, Al-Manar Islamic Library and Al-Rayyan Foundation for Printing, Publishing and Distribution, Beirut, Lebanon, 1421 AH / 2000 AD.

text: Among the manifestations of this moderation: Honoring the Human Being

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: {And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.} (1) For Allah created him with His Hand, breathed into him from His Spirit, made His angels prostrate to him in a prostration of honor, taught him all the names, created for him a mate from himself, placed affection and mercy between them, and dwelled them in His Paradise. He left them complete freedom to enjoy eating from it wherever they willed abundantly, except that this freedom had limits. So Allah forbade them from approaching one specific tree pointed out to emphasize the warning due to the bad consequence of the sin of eating from it for them. However, they weakened before the temptation of Satan, so he caused them to slip from what they were in, and He brought them down to the earth where Allah decreed that Adam and his descendants would be successors (Khalifah), as Allah told His angels before his creation saying: {And when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successor."} (2). He did not leave him to himself, nor did He close the door of His mercy or the blessing of His repentance regarding his forgetfulness that weakened his resolve. Rather, He inspired him with "Istighfar" (seeking forgiveness) and the worship of repentance: {Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance.} (3) And He clarified to him the path of guidance and the way of success, and warned him...

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...against the trial of that one who refused to obey his Lord by prostrating to him with the angels, out of envy from himself, arrogance, and delusion. He saw himself as more deserving of this honor because Allah created him from fire, while Adam was created from clay. Thus, Adam escaped the sin he committed, so his back was no longer burdened by it, nor did he bequeath it to his offspring after him. The children of Adam became free from what their father committed by Allah's acceptance of his repentance.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: Thus, Adam and his sons became in connection with their Lord without a human or non-human intermediary, so that he does not fall into exploitation, nor expose himself to the violation of his secrets and the distortion of his honor. Whenever he commits a bad deed, he has only to hasten to repentance and turning back, and he will find Allah Accepting of Repentance and Merciful: {And when My servants ask you concerning Me, indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.} (1) Indeed, some bad deeds are changed by the Generous, the Forgiving, the Accepter of Repentance, the Forbearing into good deeds: {Allah will change their sins into good deeds, and ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.} (2). Islam has encouraged repentance in the Book and the Sunnah with various incentives, leaving no room for despondency and despair of God's mercy, even if one comes with the most imaginable sins and transgressions, provided one does not associate partners with Allah: {Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills.} (3) By this, He opened the doors of good before the human being to return to the middle state between fear and hope with good opinion of his Lord, and to the Straight Path so that he may shade himself in the shadows of God's mercy and pardon, and derive his true and correct knowledge of his Lord. Then he enjoys the Good Word in his life, which is...

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...good entirely, like a good tree, its root is firmly fixed and its branch is in the sky, yielding its fruit at all times by permission of its Lord (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) See: Tafsir Al-Razi, Al-Kashhaf, Ibn Kathir, Adwa' Al-Bayan, and others.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: Repentance is one of the characteristics of moderation in Islam. It leaves the door open for the servant to renew his connection with his Lord without intermediary or brokerage, and without despair or cutting off hope leading the sinner and the committer of evil deeds to persist in his stubbornness and error. This is because Allah Almighty honored the children of Adam by creating them upon the Fitrah (natural disposition). No matter what impurities, turbidity, and veils affect it, the depth remains sound. Therefore, the Almighty said, addressing the believer: {Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.} {But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].} (1). For man is good in his depths, possessing a readiness for affection and tolerance and connecting what was severed, but he needs to be addressed, treated, and his stubbornness and persistence in enmity countered with what is better, which can penetrate those veils to touch the Fitrah upon which Allah created him, so his enmity turns into intimate friendship and close bond. Unlike Satan, who is pure evil by nature and does not accept a bribe, so nothing works with him except seeking refuge in Allah. Among the manifestations of moderation is Allah honoring man with the doctrine of Monotheism (Tawhid), which is characterized by rational and spiritual balance; there is no denial of divinity...

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...nor exaggeration in it nor idolatry. Monotheism is a doctrine innocent of negligence and excess, and of extremism away from the Straight Path to the right or left: {And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way.} Among God's honoring of man is the right to life. Whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. But if he takes a life intentionally, then it is a life for a life, and in the Hereafter, he is eternal in the Fire. Also among Islam's honoring of man is the declaration of the principle of liberating slaves through manumission, which counts as a door of drawing close to Allah, and through financial penalties like certain expiations. The master in Islam does not own the humanity of his slave, but owns his neck, i.e., his work and service. As for his humanity, no. If he is permitted to discipline him, it must not exceed ten strikes, just as he disciplines his family (1). If he mutilates his slave, he [the slave] becomes free against him [the master], and this is the school of the Hadith jurists. And if a man forces his slave or the female slave of another into immorality, they become free against him, and he guarantees to the other for his female slave with a similar one (2).

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: It is not known in the history of Islamic conquests that they exterminated peoples as other nations did in order to replace them with Muslims, or enslaved peoples as others did through invasion and aggression, bringing them to new colonies and selling them in markets like livestock to exploit them in the most hideous exploitation. Rather, peoples used to convert to Islam voluntarily. Those who refused lived according to their religion, as we see in many Arab lands and others such as the Levant: "Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Palestine, Iraq, Egypt, and the Jews in the Maghreb and Sudan." As for India, Persia, Andalusia, and others, the Islamic conquest also recognized the other and did not force anyone to enter Islam. Whereas when the Christian kings of the Peninsula won, they conspired to exterminate the Muslims, burn their books and heritage, and turn their mosques into churches. Not a single book remained in Spain from the millions of books authored, acquired, copied, and produced by the scholars, stationers, and scribes of Andalusia... As for the books in the Escorial Library, they are of Moroccan origin, pirated by a French corsair, then taken by the Spanish who placed them in the Escorial Monastery, and most of them were destroyed by burning and other means!!

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: Were it not for the Islamic conquest in Andalusia, the Jews, who were subjected from time to time to calamities and woes by the kings of the Peninsula before the Islamic conquest, would have been eradicated. Under Islam, they attained rights, favor, and scientific, social, and political status that none of them denies. As for the Muslims, they are still being exterminated to this day; Bosnia and Chechnya are examples of that.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: From the moderation of Islam: Making its greeting "Peace" (Salaam), and its relations with others: Peace: {And if they incline to peace, then incline to it}. And kindness to everyone who does not fight us, nor drive us out of our homes, nor aid an enemy against us; acting justly towards them is obligatory: {Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly}. And fulfilling covenants: {And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it} {And those who fulfill their promise when they promise} {And fulfill the covenant. Indeed, the covenant will be questioned} {So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them} (1). Since Islam is the religion of the Middle, and among the meanings of that is Justice: Justice and equity are foundations of Islamic civilization, even with those who hate us: {And do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness}.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The Quranic verses, Prophetic Hadiths, and practical applications are numerous, all demonstrating the greatness of the justice of this religion, which has remained strong due to it until now, despite the weakness and turmoil that has affected this pillar. The rule "Justice is the basis of dominion" is an Islamic rule. The Almighty says: {And when you judge between people to judge with justice} (1). He did not say 'and when you judge between Muslims', so justice is comprehensive for all. And the Almighty says: {Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded} (2). Ibn al-Qayyim says: "The Sharia is built and founded upon wisdom and the interests of servants in livelihood and the Hereafter. It is all justice, all mercy, all benefit, and all wisdom. So any issue that departs from justice to injustice, from mercy to its opposite, from benefit to harm, and from wisdom to futility, is not from the Sharia, even if entered into it by interpretation (3). Therefore, injustice will be darknesses on the Day of Resurrection. Allah has forbidden injustice upon Himself as He forbade it upon creation, and made it obligatory for them not to oppress one another. The prayer of the oppressed is answered, even if this oppressed person is a disbeliever, for there is...
foot_note:
1. (1) An-Nisa: 58. 
2. An-Nahl: 90. 
3. I'lam al-Muwaqqi'in 'an Rabb al-'Alamin 3 / 3.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: ...no veil between it and Allah. Ibn Khaldun titled a chapter of his *Muqaddimah* saying: Chapter Forty-Three: 'Injustice signals the ruin of civilization' (1). He says after citing a story indicating the ruin of nations due to the prevalence of injustice: "When injustice was, as you have seen, a signal for the cutting off of the species due to what it leads to of ruining civilization, the wisdom of banning it was present, so its prohibition was important. Its evidences from the Quran and Sunnah are many, more than can be captured by the law of limitation and enumeration (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Al-Muqaddimah p. 353, Dar Al-Fikr edition, Beirut. 
2. See his book: A Look at the Future of Humanity: Issues that Cannot Wait p. 87, translation by Dr. Mahmoud Ali Makki, Egyptian Society for the Dissemination of World Knowledge and Culture 1987, Cairo, Egypt.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: With this justice, Islamic civilization was able to preserve for the world a society of diverse cultures and religions, even ancient cultures that remained as witnesses to extinct civilizations like the Assyrian, Phoenician, Pharaonic, and other civilizations preceding Islamic civilization. Civilizational progress is not measured by the plumb line as George Sarton, the author of the *History of Science*, says (I believe), or as Professor Dr. Federico Mayor Zaragoza, the Spanish former Director-General of UNESCO, says, by material standards manifested in a consumer society and the satisfaction of its desires to the point of gluttony and succumbing to lethargy. The new standard for true progress is that which takes its axis from the moral values that must be present in a human being qua human being (1). Progress is not measured by the advancement of knowledge and its technical applications, for this progress has reached a massive level of inflation that burdens our shoulders and makes us forget serious awareness of the danger of the problems generated by it. Dr. Federico Zaragoza asks: Do we not see how scientific progress leads to the destruction of man? (2). He quotes some great thinkers who studied Western civilization saying: "But the truth is that everything is going in a wrong way" (3).

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: The conclusion is that Western civilization, in the opinion of this great thinker who reinforces his ideas with many summaries of the thoughts of Western greats, has created a future where instead of man controlling progress, he has become a slave to it (1). The truth is that major thinkers are pessimistic about the outcome of this civilization. Dr. Zaragoza conveys this pessimism in his precious book, such as the statement of Mrs. Estefania Aldaba-Lim, who asks about the fate of moral values in a foolish consumer world: "A world of destructive inventions, a complex world, a world where we see the efforts of scientists and inventors directed towards destroying human life instead of enabling him to survive (2). What Zaragoza says was said before by Spengler," and said by many contemporaries (3).

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values
publisher: The book is published on the Saudi Ministry of Awqaf website without data
text: An advanced society is characterized by many noble qualities that are absent from a consumer society (1). He sees that the difference in cultures is the true expression of the creative human... the wise human (2). Science that brings misery and consumer progress that causes regression is what the Messenger (peace be upon him) meant by 'knowledge that does not benefit' and 'a belly that is not satisfied', and what the Holy Quran said: {[It is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know.} {They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.} {Do they not reflect within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and that between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.} {Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidences. And Allah would not ever have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.} (3).
foot_note:

Manners, as Ibn al-Qayyim says: "Is the religion entirely" (1). Ikrimah, the freed slave of Abdullah ibn Abbas, says: "Everything has a foundation, and the foundation of Islam is good character" (2). The reality of manners is the gathering of good traits; that is why the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "My Lord disciplined me and perfected my discipline." And his Lord said to him: {And indeed, you are of a great moral character.} The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was sent only to perfect good moral character, as stated in the Noble Hadith. Manners are firstly with Allah, with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and with creation: humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects. Therefore, the moderation of Islam stands out strongly in this great network of ethics and manners that surrounds the human being in all his states, at all his stations and levels, and various responsibilities. That regulation is what the Quran expresses as Taqwa (God-consciousness). He says: One of the characteristics of this ethical religion is that it is rigid in what is essential for the human soul if it desires human perfection, but flexible in what is essential for the conditions of different times which does not contradict the principles of noble ethics (2). From that Taqwa and spiritual, psychological, and mental discipline arises holding fast to the command of Allah all together, as the Holy Quran stated, warning at the same time against division, conflict, and infighting. text: To achieve this, the matter must be entrusted to its people and qualified men of education, behavior, and good example who possess the conditions: Knowledge, meaning knowledge of Sharia and knowledge of reality, i.e., the field in which he works. And Wisdom: which is the deep experience that makes him capable of dealing with the best methods, most successful means, most appropriate mechanisms, and most beautiful arts of communication to convey his idea and explain it clearly and accurately with good influence and responsiveness and achieving the best results, added to that the good attribute and arguing in the best way. Wisdom was not described by one of the two mentioned descriptions because it is 'the best' in itself and does not need an extra description (1). Perhaps Insight (Basirah) combines knowledge and wisdom, then piety and righteousness, so that the preacher becomes an influential role model through behavior and action.
foot_note: 1. (1) See: Tariq al-Hijratayn by Ibn al-Qayyim: p. 212-213, edited by Dr. Wahba al-Zuhaili - Dar al-Khair - Damascus - Beirut 1419 AH.

book_title: Islam is the Religion of Moderation, Virtues, and Eternal Values

text: The learned and working human wealth in the field of calling to Islam inside and outside the country is large, numerous, diverse, rich, and at appropriate levels. But it must coordinate and cooperate among itself before it is too late. It must also cooperate with Islamic countries and their various systems as much as possible, or at least avoid clashing with those in authority because the entire nation is threatened. It has become clear that every internal tension spreads a spirit of discontent, annoyance, and suspicion throughout society and drags into dire consequences that may extend to the infrastructure of Islam and the established bases in the nation, making it easy prey for foreign conspiracies due to the weakness and fragmentation that afflicts it. Leaders from here and there have admitted that actions from one side and reactions from another side resulted in the nation being the loser in the first and the last. Indeed, we have confirmed oral accounts that among the grave mistakes is cooperating to undermine some regimes due to their corruption or the claim thereof, because of the greater corruption that resulted from undermining them, the bitterness of which we taste every moment. Revolutionary regimes used to promise peoples paradise and cleansing the country of Zionism and its agents, but lo, these peoples are in the depths of hell and the worst blaze, weeping over the righteous past in which...

text: ...the nation enjoyed many rights and lived at a living, cultural, political, social, and moral level that it has not reached even a quarter of under coups and what followed. We must represent the moderation of Islam in our behavior, ideas, and dealings among ourselves first, then transfer it to the outside, not through ideas only but through behavior. If we could reach the peaks of Islamic values and the peaks of Islamic truth, and could descend to the plateaus of Western civilization that is thirsty, and quench it with Islamic truth and Islamic guidance, we would add a new dimension to it, "because secular civilization, the civilization of the rocket, the civilization of the electron, has acquired these things but lost a dimension it feels missing, which is the dimension of Heaven" (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) The Role of the Muslim and His Message in the Last Third of the Twentieth Century p. 38 Malek Bennabi - Dar Al-Fikr - Damascus - 1398 AH.
